result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel A Deering was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Daniel A Deering was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: and comply with all treatment recommendations.

Submit a DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge to be paid as condition of probation.

$65.00 blood draw fee to be paid as condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Good time granted.  Sentence may be transferred to Washington County.

records.addlTxt: for Exemption-faxed to MVD and cc to Atty Bennett.
To Exempt Vehicles filed by Atty Mark Bennett.
Order for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops.

Attorney Mark H. Bennett appeared.  Mr. Daniel Deering appearing by telephone.  Hearing in regard to exemption of ignition interlock on certain vehicles.  Jeep Rangler is the one that the IID is installed on.  Court will grant exemption on the 3 vehilces listed on the form.
with proposed order for IID exemption filed by Atty Mark Bennett.
Hearing on January 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Daniel A Deering in court with attorney Mark H. Bennett.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Information filed, reading waived. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 1&2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld on ct. 1, 4 yr. probation, conds: 12 months jail, Huber granted under jail rules, start today at 5 p.m., may transfer to Washington Cty. Jail. Good time granted.  $3,014 fine, 36 mo. revocation, 36 mo. IID, $65 blood draw fee. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.Submit DNA sample, pay $250 DNA surcharge. On ct. 2, $243 costs imposed.  Court granted 3 days jail credit.  Ct. 3 dismissed.
To Exempt vehicles filed by Atty Mark Bennett.

Defendant Daniel A Deering in court with attorney Mark H. Bennett.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Bennett requesting new return,  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Certified copy of Stay of Administrative Suspension along with Judical Review Request faxed to MVD.  CC to Atty Bennett.
for Stay of Administrative Review, Affidavit in Support of Motion.
Count 3 added: PAC 5th or 6th offense.

Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  No to go upon the premises where alcohol is sold for on-site consumption.  Not to possess any dangerous weapons, including guns.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant Daniel A Deering by video, in custody with attorney Brian Severson on behalf of the public defenders office.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $500.00 cash bond.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  No to go upon the premises where alcohol is sold for on-site consumption. Not to possess any dangerous weapons, including guns.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:40 pm.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
